intro: Petrorhagia kennedyae, commonly known as Kennedy's rockrose, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy stems and leaves. The plant produces vibrant pink to red flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. Due to its ornamental value and drought tolerance, it is often cultivated in xeriscaped gardens.
